selected_quotes: Strong Coupling of a Single Electron in Silicon to a Microwave Photon. (arXiv:1703.03047v1 )
Strong Coupling of a Single Electron in Silicon to a Microwave Photon. (arXiv:1703.03047v1 [cond-mat.me... #physics
@yelwad that's the link to the white paper. I'm reading it now

citation.abstract: Silicon is vital to the computing industry due to the high quality of its native oxide and well-established doping technologies. Isotopic purification, and the resulting seconds-long quantum coherence times, have recently put Si at the forefront of efforts to create a solid state quantum processor. Here we demonstrate strong coupling of a single electron in a silicon double quantum dot to the photonic field of a microwave cavity, as shown by the observation of vacuum Rabi splitting. Strong coupling of a quantum dot electron to a cavity photon would allow for long-range qubit coupling, and the long-range entanglement of electrons in semiconductor quantum dots.
citation.publisher: American Association for the Advancement of Science
citation.title: Strong coupling of a single electron in silicon to a microwave photon

news.title: An Electron-Photon Dialogue in Silicon
news.summary: Research News Stewart Wills Less than a centimeter in width, the device from the Princeton-HRL team can achieve coherent coupling of a single photon and an electron in a double quantum dot, electrically controlled by nanowire gate electrodes.
